titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Aurelisu B. Hull papers 1981.002
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-07-19 17:56:11 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: This collection includes land records concerning property owned by Aurelius B. Hull on Remsen Street in Brooklyn. The papers span the period 1879 to 1918 and measure 0.1 linear feet.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder with no particular arrangement.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Aurelius B. Hull papers, 1981.002; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2024.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes land records concerning property owned by Aurelius B. Hull on Remsen Street in Brooklyn. The papers span the period 1879 to 1918 and measure 0.1 linear feet.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials in this collection are in the public domain.

controlaccess.subject: Land titles
Real property -- New York (State) -- Kings County -- Periodicals
